data.name: 150_Option_0
data.value: Please tell me.

data.name: 150_Option_1
data.value: No, I'm prepared.
Aaaah, hey...
Fidget!
Yes, but you're the one with the big mouth.
HEY!
Looks like the snow hasn't fully settled yet. We should be careful - the slightest wrong move could set off another avalanche.
Don't look at me! You're the one who can't fly.
Whoa! What was that?
Don't hold back, Fidget.
Yeah, take that!
Meanie.
Well, I see a way up, but I won't be able to reach those ledges without some help.
Let's look around. Maybe we'll find another way to tackle this cliff.
Every moment has a purpose, Fidget. You just have to dig deeper.
Well, that made absolutely no sense!
Dust, be careful! Watch overhead - the snow is not the only thing you are shaking loose.
Well, that did something.
Huh?
It sure did! You know what I'm thinking? I'm thinking we find another one.
Fidget, I think the bitter cold is creating lapses in your judgment.
That obviously wasn't enough. We need to break more pillars!
Oog.
That is ridiculous! I'm perfectly-... perfectly-... *AH-CHOO!*
It is.
Very well! Let's do this thing!
You mean... make another avalanche?
Sorry, Dust - I don't think you're double-jumping over that. Stupid avalanches ruin everything! Go ahead, name me one good thing an avalanche has ever done!
That's the idea, yes.
It's really the only way, Ahrah.
Well, now that you mention it... this might be a crazy idea, but maybe we can clear some of the snow off of that mountainside.
You're crazy. I love it.
Yeah, Ahrah! It really is! Is it?
Really? Do I need to be the voice of caution here? Need I explain how creating an avalanche puts us all in danger?
Not enough! We'll need to find more if we're going to clear away that snow!
Not- not enough!
*AH-CHOO!*
That's two.
Never!
We really should get you someplace warm, Fidget. I think you're coming down with something.
Is it gone?!
I think so. Is that who Cora was talking about?
Well, this Cora woman better start explaining herself! I can't take any more of this!
That... is a lovely singing voice.
Stop, Fidget. Just stop.
Aaaah... I think I'm coming down with something.
Yes, Fidget. We figured that on our own. Come, Dust, let us continue.
That's all of them. I'm sensing a pattern with these items, but we'll let Cora explain. Let's return to the center of the meadow.
All the way up here? Do you think it's that Moonblood camp Kane was talking about?
Look! Up ahead! A village!
No, it's something else. It's... Enough talking, let's get up there.
There... there was a road here. I remember it. Before that day.
And you thought this was a bad idea.
The path above has been made clear. Onward and upward.
Be careful, Dust. I sense a powerful presence has been stirred by your actions.
Oh, wow! That definitely did something! C'mon, let's get back to the surface!
Let's not keep it waiting, then.
You... you were dead! No, no - this is not possible. I don't know what demon you are, but you will not step any closer! Kill this... thing!
Cassius!
What did you call me? Who are you! What are you doing in this place!
What? No... impossible!
Halt!
It's not my name. I'd remember it. I'd know it when I heard it.
Why!? Why destroy such a peaceful place? We didn't want any of this!
Dust? What are you talking about? And... who is Cassius? That's not-?
But I don't remember any of it! I remember this place, but it feels like it's been more than a year! Ahrah, what does it mean?
It only means that things are not as they seem. Explore the village further, Dust. Let us see what secrets it hides.
This was Ginger's village. I was here... one year ago. According to Fuse, according to Ginger, I helped murder everyone in this village.
Oh, Dust...
A year, actually.
Huh? How do you know that?
Looks like this place has been destroyed for quite some time.
This is impossible.
Do you remember something, Dust?
This house...
How...?
But how, Ahrah? I don't understand-
Dust?
Do you see now?
The answers lie above, Dust.
Dust, that being exists in a place that I cannot reach. Run!
What is that thing?!
Mmmrff....
MMM! MmffmMM!
You mean Fidget can't talk now? At all? That's... terrible. Really, awful. Not sure how I'll get by.
Fidget? Is something wrong?
She's been silenced, Dust! While in this state, she will be unable to cast her projectiles. Fortunately, the effect is only temporary and will fade over time.
We've come this far together and you're surprised?
AAH! What IS that thing!? It's hideous!
But it has evil knife hands! EVIL KNIFE HANDS! Be careful, Dust!

data.name: 501_Option_2
data.value: How does Ahrah fit into all this?

data.name: 501_Option_3
data.value: I have no more questions. What's the plan now?

data.name: 501_Option_0
data.value: What am I, exactly?

data.name: 501_Option_1
data.value: Why couldn't I remember anything?
Phew!
Agh, here come some more!
No, wait! That's not all of them!
Exercise all you've learned, Dust. Send these foul creatures from this existence.
Whaaaaah! Look at the size of that thing!
Don't worry, I think I can handle it.
Look!
Please, help us!
Not a problem at all. Stand back!
Dust, there's something up there!
Alright, I've got it! Wait... no! Aaah-!
Very well. But something... something here is making me uneasy. Like the calm before a storm.
That is a good idea, Fidget. Let us meet with the townspeople - I am certain that the next step of your journey will reveal itself in time.
And you, in turn, do not recognize them. Yet I feel there is something here that may yet trigger your memory's return.
Maybe we should look around a bit, then? If you really have been here before, maybe somebody will recognize you!
You're right where you need to be. The answers to your identity lie somewhere in this village.
I know this place, that's for certain. I'm sure I've been here before, but nobody seems to recognize me.
It was the first thing that popped into my head! It's not like you had anything better. C'mon, let's get away from these guards.
Alright, Ahrah, where to now?
Prospectors, Fidget? That was the best thing you could come up with?
Yeah, I don't know - I just can't get a good enough grip.
Having some trouble there?
Don't worry about it. I'm sure there's a way to get up there. We'll just come back later.
Aaw, you're just trying to show off! That's sweet.
Four locks. I'll take a wild guess and say we need four keys.
There's something in that cage! Quick, get it out!
She's a cheerful one, huh?
A bit of gratitude might've been nice. What kind of a bratty-?
Hey, ease off, Dust! She looked like she was pretty depressed.
I... I don't know why I said that. I'm sorry, Fidget, I... I don't know what came over me just then. Come on, let's keep moving.
Perfect for a ranged attack! Lemme at 'em!
Blombs. Deadly creatures. Keep your distance.
They will detonate if you get too close, but are vulnerable when taking a deep breath.
Oh my. He really should've saved first.
That's great, Fidget. Really, I'll keep that in mind.
You didn't see the signals? She was giving you the signals!
Fidget, what are you talking about?
Oh, don't be so dense. It's because she likes you!
I don't know, Fidget. Why?
That went incredibly well. Do you know why?
What? That isn't you?
Do you hear something... flapping?
Wait, you're right. Look out! We've got company!
Hey, I don't make that much noise!
At least take these Feeble Fruits. Something tells me you're going to need them.
Fidget, I think things are about to get a whole lot worse.
And to think, this morning started off so well!
Is that why I summoned you? To control this power?
There is a village beyond these woods. Perhaps finding it will aid in restoring your memories.
It is unlikely, Dust, that I would awaken from my slumber for such selfish reasons.
Whoa! Nobody said anything about monsters!
And then we'll be in the clear, right? No more monsters?
You wield the Blade of Ahrah, and with it, all the skills imbued therein.
Strange... Where did I learn these skills?
Uh, hello? Monsters?!
No, no! Mash the buttons! DO SOMETHING!!
AHHH!! Monsters!
Calm yourself, Fidget. Dust, focus! Remember what you've learned thus far.
Well, I-
Alright, alright! You win! But don't think I'm leaving empty-handed! I'm coming with you!
But, um... I really need the sword back when you're done doing... you know, whatever it is you're doing.
What exactly AM I doing, Ahrah?
The answers you seek lie to the east. There is a path through the glade that leads down the mountainside, and from there you will find a village. That is your first step.
THEN will you give me the sword? I reeeeeally need to get it back home before anyone notices it's gone!
When I find out just what it is I'm supposed to do with it, it's all yours, Fidget. C'mon, let's go.
I don't have time for these games, Fidget.
I will? Oh. Well. Okay, then.
Indeed. Time is of the essence. Fidget, you will join us.
Come, Dust. We travel east.
I'm sorry, I think I misheard before. You said your name was Fidget?
Hey, this isn't about me! You're the one who's got my sword! How about you tell me YOUR name?
Calm yourself, Fidget. His name is Dust, and he is the one who woke me from my slumber.
So... Fidget, then?
That's me! And you're Dust?
It would seem that way, though I can't recall that name.
No offense, but aren't you a bit... well, small?
Hey, I just look after that thing! After two-hundred years, nobody expects a sword to just fly off and start, you know, talking.
For a guardian, I mean?
I'm kind of wishing somebody told me this was part of the job description. Or maybe they did... and I just wasn't paying attention? That happens sometimes.
Yes, well, that's all great and everything, but I think it's about time I got this sword back to the clan.
So... what is this sword?
I can't let you just leave with this sword, Fidget. Right now, it's the only thing that knows who I am. I don't even know how I got here...
I am the Blade of Ahrah, and you, Dust, are my fated sword-bearer.
Hmph! Well, then you leave me no choice! I... I challenge you! The winner gets the sword!
Summoned? How? For what purpose?
That I do not know. But we shall learn in time.
Wh... A talking sword? What are you?
Only that which you have summoned.
And who is she?
Me? I'm Fidget! Guardian of this sword!
Now rise, and claim the Blade of Ahrah.
Huff, huff... Stop... stop right there!
Arise!
Dust...
...Dust
Well, my kind has what you'd call a sixth sense, and there's something just ahead!
What is it, Fidget?
Hmm...
Hold [Y] to perform the DUST STORM. But beware! Skilled as you may be, you cannot maintain the storm for long without hurting yourself.
I like it.
Please contain yourselves as I demonstrate:
In that case, maybe I can help! If you press [B], I'll perform an attack so spectacularly awesome that it'll produce emotions you didn't even know existed.
Hmph! Well, maybe I'll just keep the rest of my repertoire to myself.
Actually, Dust, between the three of us, this could be quite useful.
That was, uh... very pretty.
I'm sorry, Fidget. I'm sure it'll come in handy somehow.
The DUST STORM can manipulate Fidget's projectile into a more powerful attack. Observe:
Hold here, Dust. You have unlocked a new ability. Bear witness to the DUST STORM!
Oh, by the way, every time I use my power, it'll use up a bit of ENERGY METER. You can recharge the meter with Melee Combos.
Wow!
However, if you are struck by an enemy, the chain will be broken and you will lose your bonus experience.
Yes, Dust - between your Combos and Fidget's own powers, you can achieve a higher HIT CHAIN, which will yield bonus experience after each battle.
If this is all too much for you, you can check out the HELP screen via the PAUSE MENU by pressing [START].
Alright, I think I understand.
Thanks, Fidget. I'll take a look if I'm ever in trouble.
Aaah... yeah, okay. I'll try to be more careful.
Keep an eye on your color. If you start turning red and the screen begins to shake, you're close to losing it.
Whoa, what was that? Did you just hit yourself?
Dust, you must take care! Even the greatest of swordsmen cannot maintain the DUST STORM for that long!
I suppose we'll need a key, then.
Alright! We found a chest!
Correction: we found a locked chest.
Well, what are you waiting for? Smash it open!
That would be unwise, Dust. These chests are protected by arcane locks from the last era, and are well beyond my capabilities.
Very well. Proceed as you wish, Dust.
Then perhaps you recognize the village at the base of these cliffs?
It's hard to make out from here. We'll need to drop down to the valley floor if we want to get any closer.
... Wow.
Yeah. So, any idea where we are?
It's really beautiful up here.
Oh, silly me! I seem to have dropped all my detailed maps and navigational equipment chasing after a crazy flying sword.
I was maybe hoping you could tell me.
Well you should be! Taking my sword, getting me in trouble...
I'm sorry I got you mixed up in this, Fidget.
You know, now that I think about it, this isn't the first time I've seen this view. I've stood here before, in this very spot.
Hey, you just leveled up!
As it should, Dust. You've acquired a Skill Gem. Open the Character screen through the Inventory to upgrade your abilities and become even more powerful.
Is that what I did? It feels good! Great, even!
Now, put this beast out of its misery.
Attack and hold [X] at the moment of the enemy's strike, and you will parry their attack, opening them up for a counter-attack.
Hey, you dazed it!
And as you can see, a successful parry may also daze your opponent temporarily.
Timing is crucial, and you must be facing your opponent.
They're persistent, I'll give them that.
Allow it to strike.
AH! It's another one of those spiky slime things!
Much as I pity this corrupted beast, now might be a good time to demonstrate the parry technique.
GAH! Whatever it is, it's got glowing evil eyes of evil!
Is that a tent? Is there somebody in there?
Psh! I wasn't frightened! Just... surprised. At the, uh... savings! C'mon, let's talk to him!
A merchant lies in wait. Do not let his appearance frighten you - I sense he only wishes to assist in our journey.
Way behind.
Don't worry, Dust! I'll be behind you every step of the way.
Be on your guard, Dust. I sense a powerful foe ahead of you.
Looks like we're heading in the right direction.
I'm no expert, but it looks like a key.
Then again, I usually don't see swords floating around by themselves either.
Whoa, what is that?
Well, I'm a key EXPERT, and they're not supposed to float around like that!
These keys are imbued with the same arcane powers as the chests they unlock. You can use any key on any chest, but once you've used a key, it will lose its power and cannot be used again.
Ask them if they've got anything to eat.
I see somebody over there.
Hey, I'm not a pet! But, uh... I would appreciate that, thanks.
We're in a bit of a hurry, Fidget. Don't worry, I'll feed you later.
That did it! I can hear the water rushing below.
You're not very subtle, but that wasn't half bad.
This was done recently.
We don't have time to wait for it to die out. There's got to be another way around.
We must be getting close.
Look.
How can you tell?
We may still be able to save the others. Let's hurry.
Ha! I laugh at the dark! Actually, I'm afraid of heights.
Finally, we're out of those caverns.
Wait, heights? How's that possible? You fly all the time. Everywhere.
What's the matter? Afraid of the dark?
Oh, do I? I must've forgotten! Just like you must've forgotten that I can still fall AT ANY TIME!
Never looked at it that way. You're an interesting one, Fidget.
So that's why you picked Cassius and Jin. Just like you said... Opposites.

Exactly. Cassius was one of the greatest warriors this world has ever seen, and Jin's purity of heart would help guide our warrior to save our kind. From their fallen souls, you were born. Born to save us. To save this world.
Who... or, I guess, what am I?
You are what my people call Sen-Mithrarin. "He Who Is Born of the Dust", created from the essence of the Life Thread itself.

You see, my people have been on the verge of extinction for a great many years. General Gaius planned to eradicate us once and for all, and while our warriors are proud and strong, what chance would we have against such a powerful foe?
To defeat General Gaius and save our people, we would need a warrior capable of standing against an entire army. This warrior would also need to be pure of heart. Incorruptible.

You saved Mudpot and brought the waters of life back into this land. You purged a demonic rage from this land and even helped two old souls find peace once more. You may not have known your purpose, but that did not stop you from fulfilling it.
Yes, now you are here, and we can finish this fight once and for all.
And now I'm here.
Why did I only remember now? I didn't even recognize Ginger when I met her...
I had no idea who I was - what my purpose was...

You may possess the souls of two separate beings, but your body and mind are your own. You were created to save this world, so we felt giving you memories of either soul would simply distract you from the task at hand.

You say that, but in all cases, you did exactly what we intended you to do. You saved complete strangers outside of Aurora Village. You stopped our wayward brother, Fuse, from destroying all that we sought to save.
What have you done? You murdered all these innocent people...
So. You've come.
Your children? You're talking about those monsters back there? Who are you?
You dare speak to me of innocence when you have so casually slain a countless number of my children?
So, you don't remember my name? Rest assured, my friend, this time you will not so easily forget it!
So we combined your brother's soul with that of his murderer, the Royal Assassin known as Cassius. They perished at the same time, forever entwined. Never before had I heard of such an event.

However, to suit our needs, we required two souls. A soul of innocence is a noble thing, but without skill, without power, Dust would have been struck down just as easily as your brother was on that fated day.
No...
They do look remarkably similar to your brother's, yes. That is because his soul lives on within Dust.
What!?
What did you mean just then? That I can finally see the truth? What do you know about me?
His eyes, Elder... They are Jin's eyes...
Who are you?
I am Elder Gray Eyes, leader of the Moonblood people. Well, what's left of them, that is.
Ginger... I don't know. I... I don't know.
I never knew what happened. Jin just disappeared one night... I had always hoped he would turn up alive someday...
Now, Dust, I imagine you have many questions. Please, do not hesitate to ask them.
It's not possible... I couldn't even remember you when we met.
That he would come back... But... could you really be him?
A grave injustice was done that day. Cassius murdered a defenseless Jin, but his pride and arrogance proved to be his undoing.
You are Jin, yes. But you are also Cassius. Two souls, forever at odds, one of innocence, one of power. Together, you form the one we call Mithrarin. "He who is born of the dust".
But how? How can this... this thing be my brother?
Dust, your friend seems awfully tense.
No, I'm fine! C'mon, let's go to the blowy-up mountains! Really, I'm serious!
I have no more questions. What now?
You must join us in the Moonblood camp to the north, in the Everdawn Basin.
That isn't anywhere near the Everdawn volcanos, is it?
They are one in the same, yes.
Well, that's fantastic.
Volcanos?
Indeed. What better place to hide than in the most volatile land in all the kingdom?
Oooh, I know! How about a peaceful meadow? Or a quiet forest? Or some place that doesn't EXPLODE every ten minutes!?
Fidget, you need to have more faith in me.
I'll have faith in you when you have faith in yourself! How about it, huh? Who are you, really?
I'm sorry, I just... Nobody's ever said that to me before.
And it won't be the last time, I assure you.
Are you ready, Mithrarin?
I am.
Then we will meet you in the Everdawn Basin.
Goodbye, Dust. We'll see you there.
... Can you, uh... can you repeat that?
I said... I can't do this without you.
I am... I... ah...
Fidget, please calm down. You mustn't test your friend like this.
You see!? You still haven't figured it out, yet. Lizard guy tells you right to your face and you still don't know!
I understand, Fidget. You're right. I can't ask you to follow me.
I just... If I'm going to follow you to the literal END OF THIS WORLD, I need to know who I'm following, and why.
I just don't get it. It doesn't matter who he thinks he is - he's Dust. That's who he is. That's who I know.
But I can. Fidget, you have stood by Dust's side for this entire journey. You have watched him save this world. How can you continue to doubt?
Fidget, please... I can't do this without you.
After the village was destroyed... I guess he lost his mind.

He was horribly disfigured after the attack. The only way he could survive was in a special suit of magical armor that I helped to construct. He demanded we attack General Gaius right away, but I would not hear any of it. He would have killed us all in the name of vengeance. We would not have stood a chance.
Who was Fuse? He said he was a Moonblood, but he looks nothing like you...
Fuse... He was once a fine warrior, and a close friend of Ginger's family. He would help transport goods between this village and our camp.
No, you were right to kill him. If he had remained alive, there's no telling what damage he could have done.
Ginger is right. Fuse was beyond saving. For all our sakes, I hope the same is not true of the world he sought to protect.

When I refused to send our warriors into battle, he called me a coward and vowed that he would destroy Gaius with or without my help. I fear the very armor we made to save his life had corrupted his mind and body beyond repair.
Poor guy... if only we could've gotten through to him somehow...
Master Gray Eyes has lived for a very long time, Fidget. Longer than any of you.
It has been a long time, Master.
Wait just a second! How can you possibly know each other? My clan's been keeping the sword hidden for over two-hundred years!!
So, you were sent to keep an eye on me?
To help you reach your true potential. Nothing more.
The Blades of Elysium were created to guide their sword bearers, Dust. I was summoned to your side to ensure a balance was maintained between the souls within you.
Ah, my old friend... it is good to hear your voice once more.
Wait, wait, wait - what the heck is the "Way of the Flameless Light"?
How does the Blade of Ahrah fit into all this? What is it, exactly?
A path we Moonbloods continue to follow. It is a way of living, a way of thought, that allows us to make use of a power both old and great. Magic, without magic.
I... may have skipped over that chapter?
It is one of the five Blades of Elysium. Ancient weapons forged when our kind were many and the Way of the Flameless Light was commonplace.
I am SO confused.
You haven't answered my question.
Surely as nimbat sword-guardian you've studied the ancient doctrines? You must know in the event that the sword is summoned by its rightful owner you are obligated to follow?
You are the only monster here, puppet! As I turn your bones to char, your final thought will be that Fuse was victorious! Now, DIE!
I don't care what your name is. You're no different than those monsters I fought before. And like them, you will fall to my blade!
What is it, Ahrah?
We've made it this far, Fidget. Stay close to me and you'll be fine. What do you see, Ahrah? Anything?
Another enemy stands before you, but this one...
Aaah, I really don't like the look of this...
Such... hatred. Be careful, Dust.

data.name: 503_Option_0
data.value: Who was Fuse?
Halt! Who goes-! Oh, it's you! Apologies, Mithrarin. Please, enter.
AH! Dust, look out!
Oh no... Dust, look!
It's the missing sentry. What happened here?
Uh, did you hear something?
There! The warriors are gathering.
Ah, Mithrarin, superb timing! As you can see, our path out of the camp is blocked. Some manner of rockslide. Very unpredictable.
Yes, that happens sometimes when you build your village in a volcanic wasteland.
Anyway, we will need to clear this obstruction before we can exit the camp.
I'll see what I can do.
Wait, what?
Honestly, Fidget, where would I be without you?
Probably still be wandering around in the mountains outside Aurora.
Well done, Fidget. The camp should now be receiving power.
Ha! What I meant to say was, don't worry about it!
Okay, that's the generator and the water pump back online. Let's return to Sanjin.

data.name: 506_Option_1
data.value: I am a soul of power tempered with vengeance. I am Cassius.

data.name: 506_Option_0
data.value: I am the soul of an innocent tempered with justice. I am Jin.

data.name: 506_Option_2
data.value: I am Dust.
I don't want to risk damaging the pump trying to cut those vines. Maybe there's some way we can burn them off?
Well, this is the water pump. Huh! No wonder it stopped! These vines are growing all over it.
I sense no energy emanating from the device, Dust. Perhaps there is a way to return its spark?
Well, there's the generator. Let's see if we can find a way to get it working again.
Aaw, stop. You're making me blush!
Alright, that seemed to fix it! Nice work, Fidget!
Well done! Let us begin our assault! We're right behind you, Sen-Mithrarin!
It's getting really hard to see. I'm starting to regret coming down here.
Ha! I was regretting it minutes ago!
Oh, hush!
How could you possibly see anything in here with that big hat over your eyes? I hate caves! Our kind isn't meant to be underground. We should be soaring high in the wide open sky.
I thought you were afraid of heights.
I am NOT afraid of the dark! I'm afraid of the things IN the dark!
I don't see anything, Fidget.
Nyaah! Did you see something move up ahead!? I saw something move!
Fidget, you need to calm down. I thought you said you weren't afraid of the dark?
Our search has not been in vain. Let's clear this area.
I doubt it. C'mon, let's keep moving.
Oh, wow...
This is beautiful! Do you think the villagers know about this place?
We'll see about that.
Dust, wait.
This creature is too well defended for a straightforward assault.
Aaah! Okay, that was a bad idea.
It is practically invulnerable unless you stun it with a parry. Like so.
Nooooo!! Go away!
There he goes!
These aren't mushrooms, Fidget. They are called bubble sprouts, and it would be wise for us to tread lightly around them. They react rather explosively to movement.
Forget him! Take a look around! There's something horribly wrong with these mushrooms.
Wonderful.
I'm not sure, but it sure did run off in a hurry.
Whoa, what was that?!
Wait!
Ack!
Exercise patience and observe your opponent's pattern, and you will emerge victorious.
You will be unable to harm certain enemies unless they are dazed. This is one such creature.
A successful parry may daze your opponent, and will fully restore your ENERGY METER.
Timing is crucial, and you must be facing your opponent.
Attack and hold [X] at the moment of the enemy's strike, and you will parry their move, opening them up for a counter-attack.
Dust, would you like a refresher on parrying?
He went down!
Very well. Be careful.
Hmph! Let's follow him.
Dust, during the battle, I was studying Fuse's attacks. I think I might've picked up on his technique!
I've got a feeling we'll need it. Those monsters likely won't let us leave without a fight.
As you can see by the dead littering this village, that would not have been a good idea.
We did it.
I'm sure you're right. We should return to Aurora and report to Mayor Bram. There was also that name... Gaius.
He knew who I was, Fidget. He'd seen me before. If only he'd lived a moment longer... If only I'd managed to keep him alive somehow...
The lights of Elysium shine upon me.
But can they reach the darkness within you?
Who knows... who sees? My vision has left me. I return now to the Life Thread, and to my brethren.
No, no! Wait!
He even murdered his own kind. Our greatest allies amongst the warmbloods... but one escaped. She was the only one I would dare spare in the slaughter that was to come.
She? Who are you talking about? Who did I kill!?
Farewell, warmblood. Ashes to ashes...
... dust to dust.
Perhaps that is for the best. Your leader, Gaius... he led you and your fellow assassins into battle-
Assassins!?
Among the last of a dying breed. A once proud race, extinguished by your hands.
I've come to my end.
My hands?
There is sadness in your eyes. But it is not guilt. It is loss. After all you've done to my kind, you still think only of yourself.
What are you?
You and your warmblooded kin. We Moonbloods were outcast... scattered to the wind. You and others like you... they came to my village, killed my family.
I didn't... I can't remember...
Come now, Dust, he's obviously terrified. Let's go find him, and maybe get out of this raining death!
And there he goes again. You're welcome, kid.
Aaagh! Leave me alone!
There he is! Look, he's in trouble!
Keep wary of the bubble sprouts, Dust, or this battle will be over before it begins!
Picking on little ones, huh? You will most definitely regret meeting me.
I don't get it! Why would anyone want to help those awful lizard things? That Fuse guy burned down an entire village!
And Fuse is likely not the only one corrupted by General Gaius' hatred of the Moonbloods. We should speak to Ginger again to learn more about this conflict.
Don't you understand, Fidget? He wasn't born that way - General Gaius and his soldiers turned him into that monster.
These flags are a warning. The area up ahead is among the most dangerous of places.
What's all this?
I think I've heard of these arenas. It's rumored they contain precious treasures.
The challenges and creatures within are unlike anything you've dealt with before. Death will come swiftly if you are not prepared.
Just little bits here and there. Think we should go in?
Hey, your memory's coming back!
Um, I certainly hope you've saved.
Children or not, they don't look all that happy to see us.
Well, Fuse did say they were his children.
What's the problem?
Hmm, more monsters.
It was a valiant effort, Fidget.
There's just no pleasing some people.
Hey! Ugly! Are you going to play nice?
Yes, very nasty! We should go around, I think.
Well, here goes nothing.
End of the line. Looks like a pretty nasty drop.
There's no time to find another route. Those monsters came up through here, there's got to be a path down below.
You've been poisoned!
Ugh, what is this?
I can probably just wait it out...
When you're poisoned, your life slowly drains down to nothing. If you don't take care of it soon, death is inevitable.
Stop pretending you're so tough! Here, take this mushroom! It will stop the poison for now. You can thank me later.
I didn't think those monsters were smart enough to build a fence.
I'm certain they didn't. Let's hop on over.

data.name: 002_Option_0
data.value: Well, hang on a second...

data.name: 002_Option_1
data.value: Enough of this.
Hmm?
Wait... did you just?
Yeah. What?
Did you just put that thing in your Inventory?
Okay then.
He's sleeping peacefully. Let's leave him alone.
As you wish, General.
Where are you, my friend? Why are you hiding from me?
Sir, the preparations are nearly complete. We've found another of their camps, but-
We... are investigating, sir. But surely you don't believe...?
Of course, sir. If that's all-
But it was deserted, of course. Keep up your search - they're going somewhere, and we need to know where that is.
What of the rumors, Commander? Is there any truth to them at all?
Commander, it is not your place to question what I believe. Our moment of glory draws near and I want results.
General Gaius? You asked for me?
Your report, Commander. What news do you bring?
Our scouts believe he is alive, General. But his actions are... curious.
Curious? How so?
He ventured into the Cirromon Caverns and saved a village of natives. As I understand it, his actions got the water flowing again. If what you tell me is true, Cassius would never-
No, Cassius would never. Keep me informed of the situation, Commander. That is all.
When did you grow a heart, my friend? Most unlike you...

Cassius is hardly a rogue element, Commander. The Moonbloods have corrupted his mind, forced him to commit these acts against us. Once I can speak with him, once he remembers who he really is, I am certain he will return to us.
Cassius, my old friend... So long as you draw breath, I will do what I can to save your broken mind. I promise.
But why welcome this rogue element? He has already slain your own soldiers - what more proof do you need that he is a traitor to our cause?
That will be for me to decide. Our paths will cross at the Moonblood camp, of that I am certain. I will speak with him personally.
But... yes sir, as you wish.
Our victory is all but assured, Commander. We outnumber them ten to one, we possess superior technology, and we have the element of surprise.
What news, Commander?
General Gaius?
I did not want to believe it, but Cassius is working with the Moonbloods. He has turned against us.
Is that... wise?
We are nearly there, Mithrarin! Once we are through their line, General Gaius will be within sight. No matter what happens, my friend, it has been an honor to fight by your side!
Mithrarin, we can't go on any further! Those enemy cannons are far too powerful. You'll need to find a way around their flank so you can destroy them!
Please, Dust is fine.
I understand. Thank you, my friend.
Ah, Sen-Mithrarin-
Well, Dust, we got this teleporter up and running just a few moments ago. If you have any business elsewhere, now is the time to do it. Once the charge begins, there's no turning back.

data.name: 001_Option_2
data.value: What is this sword, anyway?

data.name: 001_Option_1
data.value: Your name is Fidget?

data.name: 001_Option_0
data.value: You don't look like a guardian to me.
Are you ready to leave, Dust?
I think so, yes. We need to get back to the surface and find that manor Lady Tethys mentioned.
Yes, I know of the place she spoke of. An old estate at the foot of the mountains called the Sorrowing Meadow.
The Sorrowing Meadow? Is that somewhere between Blood-Death Gulch and Endless Pain Hill?
It was not always called that, Fidget. It was once a peaceful place, but even now, as we stand so far away from it, I can feel something nefarious emanating from its foundations.
Well, that's great. Really, I'm excited. How about you, Dust? You excited?
I'm just thrilled, Fidget. C'mon, let's get back to the surface.
Hey, look! Sunlight! Fancy that!
A final parting gift from Lady Tethys, it would seem.
That'll help when we need to return to the surface, but right now we should find Bopo. Lady Tethys seemed convinced we would arrive too late.
We'll get there in time! We have to! We did everything we were supposed to!
You have much to learn about the world, Fidget. Sometimes, even your best is not enough to avert fate. Come, let us make haste to the village.
This world belongs to the strong, Cassius! It belongs to us! Don't you remember your duty? Don't you remember your friends?
I remember everything. And it changes nothing!
Don't you remember anything, Cassius? Why would you draw your blade against your fellow soldiers? Why would you draw your blade against ME?
You are destroying this world, Gaius. You and your soldiers cannot be allowed to continue your campaign.
What did you call me?
Cassius! That's who you are!
You've been charged to destroy. Not me.
What... happened to you, Cassius?
Cassius...?
Do you not remember your own name? What have those damned Moonbloods done to you?
General Gaius!!
Wait! Wait... just a moment. Lower your weapons. I said lower your weapons!
You have much to answer for, General.

And what of you, my friend? A year ago I heard stories of your death. At the hands of a child, no less! Now here you stand, not only alive, but leading the very creatures we've been charged to destroy!
It's all that matters! All those people I killed, Fidget... How could I possibly redeem myself in a mere few days?
You cannot, Dust. This was never about redeeming Cassius. But then, you are not Cassius.
Yes, and you carried them out. Lower your blade, old friend. First we destroy these Moonbloods once and for all, then I can help rid you of these fantasies that have spoiled your mind!
Cassius was my name...
Dust, listen to me-
Don't listen to him! You're Jin now! Remember that!
That doesn't matter.
You're remembering now, aren't you? Together, nothing stood in our way. We shaped this world together, and together we can finish what we started!
You ordered the deaths of countless people. Countless Moonbloods... Moonblood sympathizers... anyone that stood in your way!
Then you've finally come to your senses?
Cassius would destroy the Moonbloods, but Jin - he would protect them.
No, Fidget. You're wrong... Jin didn't do any of those things.
Why do you keep saying that!?
Because you're not just Cassius! Jin didn't kill those people! Jin saved Aurora and Mudpot Village! Jin stopped Fuse, saved Lady Tethys, and now he's the only thing standing against General Gaius!
But I share his form, his very soul...
That. Doesn't. MATTER!
No, Fidget - this is the end of the trial. We'll need the full version if we want to venture any further.
Oh! Well, thanks for playing the trial! Unlock the full version to experience the drama... the ADVENTURE... the... well, you get the idea! Hope to see you again soon!
Wait a moment, Fidget. Our path is blocked. We cannot progress any further.
What, that door? Smash through it! Do your spinning fling-a-ma-jig! Use the no-clip cheat!
This is where it ends, Gaius!
You never could scare me either, Cassius. Very well. To the death!
Stop calling me Cassius!
You cannot win, Cassius! You never could beat me.
Not anymore, General. I'm not your ally, and I'm not your friend. Now raise your blade or drop it.
There was a time when you stood by my side. We were allies once!
Calm yourself, Fidget. His name is Dust, and he is the one who woke me from my slumber.
Hey, this isn't about me! You're the one who's got my sword! How about you tell me YOUR name?
And who is she?
Huff, huff... Stop... stop right there!
Yes, well, that's all great and everything, but I think it's about time I got this sword back to the clan.
It would seem that way, though I can't recall that name.
That's me! And you're Dust?
So... Fidget, then?
Hmph! Well, then you leave me no choice! I... I challenge you! The winner gets the sword!
I can't let you just leave with this sword, Fidget. Right now, it's the only thing that knows who I am. I don't even know how I got here...
Come, Dust. We travel east.
Indeed. Time is of the essence. Fidget, you will join us.
I will? Oh. Well. Okay, then.
I don't have time for these games, Fidget.
